Either the organization does not have the RDF type "http://example.com/DeliveryPartyRole" or, if it does have the "http://example.com/DeliveryPartyRole" type, then the property vcard:postalCode must be present exactly once (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1), and its value must be a string with a maximum length of 9 characters. If neither of these conditions is met (i.e., the organization is a delivery party but the postal code is missing or invalid), the validation will fail with the message: "The data element 3251 is missing for the Segment NAD+DP, i.e. specification of the postal code of the delivery address."

The SHACL shape :Waehrung targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It specifies a property constraint on schema1:currency, requiring exactly one value (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). The value must be a string (xsd:string). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The CUX segment in the invoice header is missing".

The SHACL shape :EANAtrikelnummer targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property edifact-o:hasProductIdentification must be present exactly once (minimum count 1), its value must be a string (xsd:string) and must be "International Article Number", or the property edifact-o:itemNumberSupplier must be present exactly once (minimum count 1) and its value must be a string (xsd:string). If neither of these conditions is met (i.e., the EAN article number or the supplier's article number is missing or invalid), the validation will fail with the message: "The LIN segment with the value EN in data element 7143 is missing, i.e. the specification of the EAN article number or the PIA segment with the value SA in data element 7143 is missing, i.e. the specification of the supplier's article number."

The SHACL shape :BerechneteMenge applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:deliveredQuantity, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a maximum length of 15 characters. The value must appear exactly once (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The segment QTY+12 is missing, i.e. the specification of the calculated quantity."

The SHACL shape :BerechneteMenge targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property p2p-o-doc-line:invoicedQuantity, requiring exactly one value (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1). The value must be a float (xsd:float) with a maximum length of 15 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The segment QTY+47 is missing, i.e. the specification of the calculated quantity."

The SHACL shape :BerechneteMenge targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasLineItemAmount, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a maximum length of 14 characters, and exactly one occurrence (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, or its value is not a float or exceeds the maximum length, validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+203 is missing, i.e. the indication of the net position price."

The SHACL shape :ArtikelNettopreis targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasNetpriceOfItem, requiring exactly one value (minCount and maxCount set to 1). The value must be a float (xsd:float) with a maximum length of 13 characters. If this property is missing or appears more than once, or if its value exceeds the maximum length, validation will fail with the message: "The PRI+AAA segment is missing, i.e. the indication of the net price of an individual article."

The SHACL shape :ArtikelBruttopreis applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasGrosspriceOfItem, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a maximum length of 13 characters, and it must appear exactly once (minCount and maxCount set to 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, or its value is not a float or exceeds the length limit, validation will fail with the message: "The PRI+AAB segment is missing, i.e. the indication of the net price of an individual article."

The SHACL shape :ExistenzAuftragsnummerLieferant specifies a constraint on the property edifact-o:orderNumberSupplier, requiring it to appear at least once (minimum count 1). If this property is missing, validation will fail with the message: "The order number of the supplier, RFF+VN, is missing."

The SHACL shape :ExistenzAuftragsnummerLieferantArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:orderNumberSupplier, requiring exactly one value (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). The value must be a string (xsd:string). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The order number of the supplier, RFF+VN, is missing in the item part."

The SHACL shape :LaengeAuftragsnummerLieferantArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:orderNumberSupplier, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 35 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The order number of the supplier, RFF+VN, in the item part is too long."

The SHACL shape :ExistenzDatumAuftragsnummerLieferantArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a property constraint on edifact-o:dateOrderNumberSupplier, requiring exactly one value (minCount and maxCount set to 1). The value must be a string (xsd:string). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The date of the supplier's order number, RFF+VN, is missing in the item part."

The SHACL shape :LaengeDatumAuftragsnummerLieferantArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:dateOrderNumberSupplier, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 8 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The date of the supplier's order number, RFF+VN, in the item section must be long enough."

The SHACL shape :ExistenzAuftragsnummerKaeuferArtikel applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:orderNumberBuyer, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) that appears exactly once (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, the validation will fail with the message: "The order number of the supplier, RFF+ON, is missing in the item part."

The SHACL shape :LaengeAuftragsnummerKaeuferArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:orderNumberBuyer, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 35 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The order number of the supplier, RFF+ON, in the item part is too long."

The SHACL shape :ExistenzDatumAuftragsnummerKaeuferArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a property constraint on edifact-o:dateOrderNumberBuyer that requires exactly one value (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1), and its value must be a string (xsd:string). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The date of the supplier's order number, RFF+ON, is missing in the item part."

The SHACL shape :LaengeDatumAuftragsnummerKaeuferArtikel targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:dateOrderNumberBuyer, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 8 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The date of the supplier's order number, RFF+ON, in the item part is too long."

The SHACL shape :Rechnungsbetrag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasInvoiceAmount, requiring exactly one value (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). The value must be a string with a maximum length of 14 characters. If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+77 is missing, i.e. the invoice amount is missing."

The SHACL shape :Gesamtpositionsbetrag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasTotalLineItemAmount, requiring it to appear exactly once (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+79 is missing, i.e. the indication of the total position amount."

The SHACL shape :SummeZuAbschlaege targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasTotalAdditionsAndDeductions, requiring it to appear exactly once (minimum count 1 and maximum count 1). If this property is missing, validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+131 is missing, i.e. the indication of the sums of the additions/deductions."

The SHACL shape :SteuerpflichtigerBetrag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasTaxableAmount, requiring its value to appear exactly once (with minCount and maxCount set to 1). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+125 is missing, i.e. the indication of the taxable amount."

The SHACL shape :zusaetzlichePartneridentifikation applies to all instances of the class org:FormalOrganization. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:additionalPartnerIdentificationEANCode, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 35 characters and appearing at most once (maxCount 1). If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The RFF+API segment is incorrect, i.e. the specification of the additional partner identification."

The SHACL shape :Zahlungsbedingung applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:paymentCondition, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) that is one of the following allowed values: "As usual", "Extended", "Wie ueblich", or "Verlaengert". The property can appear up to 5 times (maxCount 5). If the value is not one of the specified options or appears more than 5 times, validation will fail with the message: "The specified payment term is not one of the expected values, i.e. data element 4279 in the PAT segment is not equal to 1 or 7."

The SHACL shape :ValutaDatum targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:valutaDate, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 8 characters and allowing at most one occurrence (maxCount 1). If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The specified value date is too long, i.e. the DTM+209."

The SHACL shape :Abschlag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasAllowanceReason, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 1 character and a maximum count of 15 occurrences. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The data element 7160 or 7161 is missing in the ALC segment, i.e. the tee type specification."

The SHACL shape :Rabatt targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a property constraint on edifact-o:hasDiscountReason, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 1 character and a maximum count of 15 occurrences. If this property is missing or its value does not meet these conditions, validation will fail with the message: "The data element 7160 or 7161 is missing in the ALC segment, i.e. the tee type specification."

The SHACL shape :Zuschlag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasChargeReason, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 1 character and a maximum count of 15 occurrences. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The data element 7160 or 7161 is missing in the ALC segment, i.e. the specification surcharge type."

The SHACL shape :AbschlagProzentsatz applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasAllowancePercentage, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum length of 1 character and a maximum length of 5 characters. The value must appear at most 15 times. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The data element 5245 or 5482 is missing in the PCD segment, i.e. the percentage type and amount of the discount."

The SHACL shape :RabattProzentsatz targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasDiscountPercentage, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum length of 1 character and a maximum length of 5 characters. The property must appear at most 15 times. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The data element 5245 or 5482 is missing in the PCD segment, i.e. the percentage type and amount of the discount."

The SHACL shape :ZuschlagProzentsatz targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasChargePercentage, requiring its value to be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum length of 1 and a maximum length of 5 characters. The value can appear up to 15 times (maxCount set to 15). If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The data element 5245 or 5482 is missing in the PCD segment, i.e. the percentage type and amount of the surcharge."

The SHACL shape :BruttoendbetragRechnunng applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property p2p-o-inv:hasAllowanceAmount or edifact-o:hasDiscountAmount must appear at most twice (maximum count 2), and their values must be strings with a maximum length of 13 characters. If neither of these properties meets these conditions, the validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+8, MOA+23 or MOA+204 is incorrect, i.e. the indication of the gross final amount of the invoice."

The SHACL shape :SteuerangabenItem targets all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasVATrate, requiring its value to appear at most 5 times (maxCount 5) and be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 5 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The TAX segment at item level is incorrect, i.e. the specification of the tax rate; TAX; SG 21; header part; is incorrect."

The SHACL shape :Produktidentifikation applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It specifies a property constraint on p2p-o-item:itemName that requires exactly one value (with minCount set to 1). The value must be a string (xsd:string). If this property is missing or appears more than once, validation will fail with the message: "The data element 7008 in the IMD segment is incorrect, i.e. the specification of the article name."

The SHACL shape :Steuerbetrag applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasTaxAmount, requiring its value to appear at most once (with maxCount 1) and to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 13 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The segment MOA+124 is incorrect, i.e. the tax amount is not specified."

The SHACL shape :ZuAbschlagbetrag applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property p2p-o-inv:hasAllowanceAmount or the property edifact-o:hasDiscountAmount must be present, and each property can appear at most twice (maxCount 2). The value of each property must be a string with a maximum length of 18 characters. If neither of these properties is present or their values are invalid, the validation will fail with the message: "The segment MOA+23 or MOA+204 is incorrect, i.e. the specification of the surcharge or discount amount is incorrect." If only one of the properties is present, the validation will fail with a more specific message, either "Das Segment MOA+23 fehlt" or "Das Segment MOA+204 fehlt".

The SHACL shape :BasisZuAbschlagbetrag applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:item. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasAdditionDeductionBasis, requiring it to appear at most once (maxCount 1) and its value to be a string with a maximum length of 13 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The MOA+25 segment is incorrect, i.e. the base amount of the surcharge or discount is incorrect."

The SHACL shape :SteuerangabenItem targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasVATrate, allowing a maximum of 5 values (maxCount 5) and requiring each value to be a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 5 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The TAX segment at totals level is incorrect, i.e. the specification of the tax rate."

The SHACL shape :Steuerbetrag targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It enforces a constraint on the property edifact-o:hasTaxAmount, requiring its value to appear at most once (maxCount 1) and be a string with a maximum length of 13 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "The segment MOA+124 is incorrect, i.e. the tax amount is not specified."

The SHACL shape :Prozesszugehoerigkeit applies to all instances of the class edifact-o:E-Invoice. It specifies a property constraint on edifact-o:belongsToProcess that requires exactly one value (with minCount and maxCount set to 1) which must be the string "ProcessExample". If this property is missing or appears more than once with a different value, validation will fail.

The SHACL shape :SumNetPrice targets all instances of the class edifact-o:InvoiceDetails. It specifies a validation rule using an sh:SPARQLConstraint, which checks that the value of the property edifact-o:hasTotalLineItemAmount equals the sum of all values of the property edifact-o:hasLineItemAmount across related line items. If this condition is not met, the validation will fail with the message: "edifact-o:hasTotalLineItemAmount must equal the sum of all values of edifact-o:hasLineItemAmount".

The SHACL shape :StudentProfileShape targets all instances of the class edu:StudentProfile. It enforces two concurrent constraints: the property edu:studentNumber must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 6 characters, and the property edu:registrationDate must be a date (xsd:date) that appears at least once (minCount 1). If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Student profile must include a student number and a registration date."

The SHACL shape :CourseCatalogShape applies to all instances of the class edu:CourseCatalog. It specifies two property constraints: one on edu:courseTitle, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters; and another on edu:creditValue, requiring its value to be an integer (xsd:integer) within the inclusive range of 1 to 20. If either of these properties does not comply with these constraints, validation will fail with the message: "Each course must have a valid title and credit value between 1 and 20."

The SHACL shape :FacultyMemberShape applies to all instances of the class edu:FacultyMember. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property edu:employeeID to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. The second constraint requires the property edu:fullName to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Faculty member must have an employee ID and full name."

The SHACL shape :ResearchProjectShape targets all instances of the class edu:ResearchProject. It enforces two constraints: the property edu:projectID must be present with exactly one value (minCount 1), and its value must be a string (xsd:string); and the property edu:fundingAmount must be present with a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum value of 0.0 (inclusive). Both constraints must be satisfied simultaneously. If either of these conditions is not met, the validation will fail with the message: "Research projects must have a project ID and funding amount."

The SHACL shape :ThesisSubmissionShape applies to all instances of the class edu:ThesisSubmission. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property edu:submissionDate to have at least one value (minimum count 1), and the value must be a date (xsd:date). The second constraint requires the property edu:evaluator to have at least one value (minimum count 1), and the value must be an instance of the class edu:Professor. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Thesis submissions must include submission date and at least one evaluator."

The SHACL shape :LibraryMemberShape targets all instances of the class edu:LibraryMember. It enforces a composite constraint consisting of two property constraints. The first property constraint requires the property edu:membershipID to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 4 characters. The second property constraint requires the property edu:expiryDate to have exactly one value (minCount and maxCount set to 1) with a date type (xsd:date). If either of these constraints is not satisfied, the validation will fail with the message: "Library membership must include a valid ID and expiry date."

The SHACL shape :ClassScheduleShape applies to all instances of the class edu:ClassSchedule. It specifies two property constraints: one on edu:timeSlot and one on edu:location. Both properties must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified length requirement, validation will fail with the message: "Class schedule must include time slot and location."

The SHACL shape :GradingPolicyShape applies to all instances of the class edu:GradingPolicy. It specifies two interdependent property constraints: one for edu:gradeScale, which must have a value that is one of "A", "B", "C", "D", or "F", and another for edu:passThreshold, which must be a floating-point number between 0.0 (inclusive) and 100.0 (inclusive). If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Grading policy must include a valid scale and threshold score."

The SHACL shape :InternshipShape targets all instances of the class edu:Internship. It enforces two constraints: a property constraint on edu:companyName, requiring its value to be a string with a minimum length of 2 characters, and a property constraint on edu:startDate, requiring exactly one value that must be a date. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Internship must include company name and start date."

The SHACL shape :EnrollmentStatusShape applies to all instances of the class edu:EnrollmentStatus. It specifies two property constraints that must both be satisfied. The property edu:isActive must have a value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean), and the property edu:semesterName must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Enrollment status must indicate if active and specify the semester."

The SHACL shape :DigitalBadgeShape targets all instances of the class edu:DigitalBadge. It enforces two property constraints: the property edu:badgeTitle must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 4 characters, and the property edu:issuedOn must be a date (xsd:date). Both properties must be present. If either of these properties is missing or does not conform to these requirements, validation will fail with the message: "Each digital badge must have a title and issue date."

The SHACL shape :AlumniRecordShape targets all instances of the class edu:AlumniRecord. It specifies two property constraints that must both be satisfied. The first constraint requires the property edu:graduationYear to have a value that is a gYear (xsd:gYear). The second constraint requires the property edu:degreeAwarded to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If either of these property constraints is violated, the validation will fail with the message: "Alumni record must contain graduation year and awarded degree."

The SHACL shape :LearningOutcomeShape targets all instances of the class edu:LearningOutcome. It specifies a combination of two constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. Firstly, the property edu:outcomeText must be present with a minimum length of 10 characters and its value must be a string (xsd:string). Secondly, the property edu:linkedCourse must be present at least once (minCount 1) and its value must be an instance of the class edu:Course. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the validation will fail with the message: "Learning outcome must describe the result and be linked to a course."

The SHACL shape :AcademicAlertShape applies to all instances of the class edu:AcademicAlert. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:and condition, requiring that both conditions are met. The first condition is a property constraint on edu:alertType, which must have a value that is one of the following: "Low GPA", "Attendance", or "Plagiarism". The second condition is a property constraint on edu:triggeredOn, which must be a date (xsd:date). If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Academic alert must include type and trigger date."

The SHACL shape :StudyAbroadShape targets all instances of the class edu:StudyAbroad. It specifies a joint constraint on two properties: edu:hostUniversity and edu:exchangePeriod, both requiring a string value (xsd:string). Both properties must be present and valid. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Study abroad info must include host university and exchange period."

The SHACL shape :AttendanceLogShape targets all instances of the class edu:AttendanceLog. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied together. The first constraint requires the property edu:presentStatus to have a value that is one of the predefined allowed values: "Present", "Absent", or "Excused". The second constraint requires the property edu:dateRecorded to have a value that is a date (xsd:date). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Attendance log must include present status and date."

The SHACL shape :CapstoneProjectShape applies to all instances of the class edu:CapstoneProject. It specifies two property constraints that must both be satisfied. The first constraint requires the property edu:projectTitle to have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. The second constraint requires the property edu:finalScore to have a value that is a float (xsd:float) within the inclusive range of 0.0 to 100.0. If these conditions are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Capstone project must have a title and a score between 0 and 100."

The SHACL shape :CertificationRecordShape targets all instances of the class edu:CertificationRecord. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The property edu:certificateName must have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. The property edu:validUntil must have a date value (xsd:date). If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Certification record must include a name and a valid until date."

The SHACL shape :DisciplinaryActionShape applies to all instances of the class edu:DisciplinaryAction. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: edu:violationType with a value that is one of the predefined strings "Cheating", "Harassment", or "Forgery", and edu:resolved with a boolean value (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Disciplinary actions must specify type and resolution status."

The SHACL shape :ExchangeProgramShape applies to all instances of the class edu:ExchangeProgram. It specifies two simultaneous property constraints: the property edu:partnerInstitution must have a string value (xsd:string), and the property edu:languageOfInstruction must also have a string value (xsd:string). Both properties are required, and if either or both are missing, validation will fail with the message: "Exchange programs must specify partner institution and instruction language."

The SHACL shape :MentorshipProgramShape applies to all instances of the class edu:MentorshipProgram. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. Firstly, the property edu:mentor must have at least one value (qualifiedMinCount 1) and each of these values must be an instance of the class edu:FacultyMember. Secondly, the property edu:menteeCount must have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1 (minInclusive 1). If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Mentorship program must have at least one faculty mentor and a mentee count."

The SHACL shape :LanguageTestShape applies to all instances of the class edu:LanguageTest. It specifies two property constraints: the property edu:testName must have a string value (xsd:string), and the property edu:resultScore must have a float value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 100.0 (inclusive). Both properties must be present for the validation to succeed. If either of these conditions is not met, the validation will fail with the message: "Language test must have a name and a score between 0 and 100."

The SHACL shape :StudentLoanShape targets all instances of the class edu:StudentLoan. It specifies a conjunctive constraint that requires two properties to be present: edu:loanAmount with a value of type float (xsd:float) that is greater than or equal to 0.0, and edu:repaymentTerm with a value of type string (xsd:string). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Student loan must include loan amount and repayment term."

The SHACL shape :TeachingAssignmentShape targets all instances of the class edu:TeachingAssignment. It enforces a composite constraint that requires two properties to be present. The first property, edu:assignedFaculty, must have at least one value (minCount 1) and its value must be an instance of edu:FacultyMember. The second property, edu:teachingHours, must have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Teaching assignment must include a faculty member and the number of hours."

The SHACL shape :HonorRollShape targets all instances of the class edu:HonorRoll. It enforces two constraints: the property edu:studentName must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and the property edu:GPA must be a float (xsd:float) with a value between 3.5 and 4.0 (inclusive). If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Honor roll entry must include student name and GPA  3.5."

The SHACL shape :EventParticipationShape targets all instances of the class edu:EventParticipation. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property edu:eventType to have a value that is one of the following strings: "Conference", "Workshop", or "Competition". The second constraint requires the property edu:participantID to have a string value with a minimum length of 4 characters. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Event participation must include the event type and participant ID."

The SHACL shape :FinalExamShape applies to all instances of the class edu:FinalExam. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. Firstly, the property edu:examCode must be present with a value that is a string (xsd:string) having a minimum length of 5 characters. Secondly, the property edu:durationMinutes must be present with a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 30. If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Final exam must include an exam code and a duration in minutes."

The SHACL shape :OnlineCourseShape applies to all instances of the class edu:OnlineCourse. It enforces two property constraints: the property edu:platform must have a value that is a string (xsd:string), and the property edu:url must have a value that is a URI (xsd:anyURI). Both properties must be present. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid data type, validation will fail with the message: "Online course must specify platform and course URL."

The SHACL shape :ExtracurricularShape applies to all instances of the class edu:Extracurricular. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied concurrently. The first constraint requires the property edu:activityName to have a value that is a string (xsd:string). The second constraint requires the property edu:weeklyHours to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 1. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Extracurricular record must include activity name and hours per week."

The SHACL shape :ScholarshipApplicationShape applies to all instances of the class edu:ScholarshipApplication. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property edu:GPA must have a float value of 3.0 or higher, or the property edu:essaySubmitted must have a boolean value of true. If neither of these conditions is met (i.e., the GPA is less than 3.0 and no essay has been submitted), the validation will fail with the message: "Applicant must either have a GPA  3.0 or have submitted an essay."

The SHACL shape :ServerSpecShape applies to all instances of the class it:ServerSpec. It enforces two concurrent property constraints. The first constraint requires the property it:cpuCores to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 2. The second constraint requires the property it:ramGB to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 4. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Each server must specify at least 2 CPU cores and 4GB RAM."

The SHACL shape :OperatingSystemShape targets all instances of the class it:OperatingSystem. It specifies two property constraints. The first property constraint applies to it:osName, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "Operating system name must be a valid string." The second property constraint applies to it:version, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string). If this property constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "Each OS must include a version string."

The SHACL shape :ProtocolSupportShape applies to all instances of the class it:ProtocolSupport. It specifies two property constraints. The first constraint applies to it:protocolType, requiring its value to be a string and to be one of the following: "HTTP", "HTTPS", "FTP", "SSH", "SFTP". If it:protocolType has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Protocol must be one of the supported types." The second constraint applies to it:isEncrypted, requiring its value to be a boolean (xsd:boolean). If it:isEncrypted is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "You must specify whether the protocol is encrypted."

The SHACL shape :FirewallRuleShape applies to all instances of the class it:FirewallRule. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. 
Firstly, the property it:portNumber must have an integer value (xsd:integer) that is within the range of 1 to 65535 inclusive. 
Secondly, the property it:ruleAction must have a value that is either "Allow" or "Deny". 
If these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Firewall rule must define a valid port and an allow/deny action."

The SHACL shape :AccessCredentialShape applies to all instances of the class it:AccessCredential. It specifies two property constraints: a property it:username with a value that must be a string (xsd:string) of at least 3 characters (minLength 3), and a property it:passwordHash with a value that must be a string (xsd:string). Both properties must be present simultaneously. If either property is missing or its value does not conform to the specified data type or length, validation will fail with the message: "Each access credential must include a username and password hash."

The SHACL shape :SystemLogPolicyShape targets all instances of the class it:SystemLogPolicy. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The property it:logRetentionDays must be an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 7, and the property it:isRotationEnabled must be a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Log policies must specify retention days and whether rotation is enabled."

The SHACL shape :BackupScheduleShape targets all instances of the class it:BackupSchedule. It specifies two property constraints. The first constraint applies to the property it:frequency, requiring its value to be one of the following strings: "Daily", "Weekly", or "Monthly". If the value does not match one of these options, validation will fail with the message: "Backup frequency must be one of: Daily, Weekly, or Monthly." The second constraint applies to the property it:isEncrypted, requiring its value to be a boolean (xsd:boolean). If this property is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "You must declare whether the backup is encrypted."

The SHACL shape :SSHConfigShape targets all instances of the class it:SSHConfig. It enforces two property constraints. The property it:port must have a value of 22 (xsd:integer), unless configured otherwise, and the property it:keyBasedAuth must be true (xsd:boolean), enforcing key-based authentication. If these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the respective messages: "SSH must use port 22 unless configured otherwise" and "SSH configuration must enforce key-based authentication."

The SHACL shape :DiskQuotaShape applies to all instances of the class it:DiskQuota. It specifies a constraint that requires two properties to be present: it:allocatedGB, which must be an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1, and it:mountPoint, which must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 2 characters. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Disk quota must define allocated space and a valid mount point."

The SHACL shape :AdminRoleShape targets all instances of the class it:AdminRole. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property it:privilegeLevel must have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 5, or the property it:hasFullAccess must have a boolean value (xsd:boolean) set to true. If neither of these conditions is met, the validation will fail with the message: "Admin role must either have privilege level  5 or full access enabled."

The SHACL shape :UserAccountShape applies to all instances of the class it:UserAccount. It enforces two property constraints: the property it:username must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 4 characters, and the property it:isActive must have a value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "User accounts must specify a username and indicate whether the account is active."

The SHACL shape :TLSCertificateShape applies to all instances of the class it:TLSCertificate. It enforces two property constraints: one on it:issuer, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and one on it:validUntil, requiring its value to be a date (xsd:date). Both properties must be present. If either property is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "TLS certificates must specify an issuer and an expiration date."

The SHACL shape :PortBindingShape targets all instances of the class it:PortBinding. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The property it:boundPort requires a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) between 1 (inclusive) and 65535 (inclusive). Additionally, the property it:protocol requires a value that is either "TCP" or "UDP". If these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Port bindings must define a valid port number and either TCP or UDP protocol."

The SHACL shape :DatabaseConnectionShape targets all instances of the class it:DatabaseConnection. It enforces a constraint that requires two properties to be present: it:connectionURL, which must be a URI (xsd:anyURI), and it:timeoutSeconds, which must be an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Database connection must include a URL and a timeout value in seconds."

The SHACL shape :AccessTokenShape targets all instances of the class it:AccessToken. It specifies a validation rule that requires the presence of two properties. The property it:tokenValue must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 10 characters, and the property it:expiresAt must be a date and time (xsd:dateTime). If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Access token must include a token value and an expiration timestamp."

The SHACL shape :LoadBalancerConfigShape targets all instances of the class it:LoadBalancerConfig. It specifies a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: it:algorithm, which must have a value that is one of "RoundRobin", "LeastConnections", or "IPHash", and it:healthCheckEnabled, which must have a boolean value. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, the validation will fail with the message: "Load balancer config must specify an algorithm and whether health checks are enabled."

The SHACL shape :EnvironmentVariableShape targets all instances of the class it:EnvironmentVariable. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: it:variableName and it:value, both of which must be strings (xsd:string). The value of it:variableName must have a minimum length of 2 characters. If either of these properties is missing or its value is invalid, the validation will fail with the message: "Environment variables must include a name and a value."

The SHACL shape :StorageMountShape applies to all instances of the class it:StorageMount. It specifies two simultaneous property constraints. The first constraint requires the property it:mountPath to have a value that is a non-empty string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 1 character. The second constraint requires the property it:filesystemType to have a value that is one of the following strings: "ext4", "xfs", or "ntfs". If either of these property constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Storage mount must define a path and a supported filesystem type."

The SHACL shape :ScheduledJobShape applies to all instances of the class it:ScheduledJob. It specifies two property constraints. The property it:jobName requires a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. The property it:cronExpression requires a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 9 characters. Both properties must be present. If either property is missing or does not meet the specified length constraints, validation will fail with the message: "Scheduled jobs must have a name and a valid cron expression."

The SHACL shape :ContainerDeploymentShape targets all instances of the class it:ContainerDeployment. It specifies two property constraints: one on it:imageName, which requires a string value (xsd:string), and another on it:replicaCount, which requires an integer value (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of at least 1 (minInclusive 1). Both properties must be present and valid. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Container deployments must specify an image name and at least one replica."

The SHACL shape :DNSConfigShape targets all instances of the class it:DNSConfig. It specifies a constraint that enforces the presence of two properties: it:primaryDNS and it:secondaryDNS, both of which must have string values (xsd:string). The value of it:primaryDNS must match the pattern "^\\d{1,3}(\\.\\d{1,3}){3}$", representing a valid IP address. The property it:secondaryDNS is optional but if present, it must also be a string. If these conditions are not met, validation will fail with the message: "DNS configuration must include a valid primary IP address and optionally a secondary one."

The SHACL shape :ApiRateLimitShape applies to all instances of the class it:ApiRateLimit. It specifies a constraint that requires two properties to be present: it:limitPerMinute and it:burstLimit, both with integer values (xsd:integer) that are greater than or equal to 1. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "API rate limits must specify per-minute and burst limits."

The SHACL shape :ProxyServerShape targets all instances of the class it:ProxyServer. It specifies a constraint that requires two properties to be present: it:proxyAddress with a string value (xsd:string) and it:requiresAuthentication with a boolean value (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Proxy servers must define an address and whether authentication is required."

The SHACL shape :MonitoringAgentShape applies to all instances of the class it:MonitoringAgent. It specifies two property constraints: one for it:agentID, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string), and another for it:isActive, requiring its value to be a boolean (xsd:boolean). Both properties must be present. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Monitoring agent must have an ID and indicate if it is active."

The SHACL shape :AlertRuleShape applies to all instances of the class it:AlertRule. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition, requiring that either the property it:thresholdValue is present with a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 0.0, or the property it:expression is present with a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5. If neither of these conditions is met (i.e., neither a valid threshold value nor a condition expression is defined), the validation will fail with the message: "Alert rules must define either a numeric threshold or a condition expression."

The SHACL shape :NetworkInterfaceShape targets all instances of the class it:NetworkInterface. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: it:interfaceName and it:macAddress, both of which must be strings (xsd:string). The value of it:interfaceName must have a minimum length of 2 characters. The value of it:macAddress must match the pattern "^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}$" and thus represents a valid MAC address. If either of these properties is missing or its value does not meet these constraints, validation will fail with the message: "Network interface must have a name and a valid MAC address."

The SHACL shape :AccessPolicyShape targets all instances of the class it:AccessPolicy. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously: first, the property it:role must have a value that is one of the strings "Admin", "Editor", or "Viewer"; second, the property it:resource must have a value that is a string (xsd:string). If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Access policies must define a role and the associated resource."

The SHACL shape :ErrorLogShape targets all instances of the class it:ErrorLog. It enforces two property constraints: one on it:errorCode, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and another on it:timestamp, requiring its value to be a date-time (xsd:dateTime). Both properties must be present. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Error logs must include an error code and timestamp."

The SHACL shape :WebServerConfigShape targets all instances of the class it:WebServerConfig. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: it:documentRoot with a value that is a non-empty string (xsd:string), and it:sslEnabled with a value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Web server config must specify document root and whether SSL is enabled."

The SHACL shape :TokenRevocationShape targets all instances of the class it:TokenRevocation. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property it:tokenID to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 8 characters. The second constraint requires the property it:revokedAt to have a date-time value (xsd:dateTime). If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Revoked tokens must include token ID and the revocation timestamp."

The SHACL shape :PriceShape targets all instances of the class catalog:PriceDetail. It enforces two constraints: 
one on the property catalog:priceValue, requiring its value to be a floating-point number (xsd:float) that is non-negative (minInclusive 0.0), 
and another on the property catalog:currency, requiring its value to be one of the following strings: "USD", "EUR", "INR", "GBP". 
If these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Price must be non-negative and include a valid currency code."

The SHACL shape :InventoryShape targets all instances of the class catalog:InventoryRecord. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The property catalog:stockQuantity must have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) greater than or equal to 0, and the property catalog:warehouseLocation must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 2 characters. If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Inventory must specify stock quantity and warehouse location."

The SHACL shape :DiscountPolicyShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:DiscountPolicy. It enforces two property constraints: the property catalog:discountRate must have a value that is a float (xsd:float) between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive), and the property catalog:validUntil must have a value that is a date (xsd:date). If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Discount policy must include a rate between 0 and 100, and a validity date."

The SHACL shape :CategoryAssignmentShape targets all instances of the class catalog:CategoryAssignment. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: catalog:assignedCategory with a value that is an IRI (Internationalized Resource Identifier), and catalog:priority with a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 1. Both properties must be present simultaneously. If either of these properties is missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Category assignment must include a category and a priority value."

The SHACL shape :SupplierInfoShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:SupplierInfo. It specifies two concurrently applicable property constraints. The first constraint requires the property catalog:supplierName to have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. The second constraint requires the property catalog:supplierRating to have a float value (xsd:float) within the range of 0.0 and 5.0 (inclusive). If either of these properties is missing or their values do not meet the specified conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Supplier info must include name and a rating between 0 and 5."

The SHACL shape :ProductImageShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ProductImage. It enforces two constraints. Firstly, it requires the property catalog:imageURL to have a value that is a URI (xsd:anyURI). Secondly, it requires the property catalog:imageType to have a value that is one of the predefined allowed values: "thumbnail", "main", or "zoomed". If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Product image must have a valid URL and type."

The SHACL shape :CustomerReviewShape targets all instances of the class catalog:CustomerReview. It specifies two property constraints: one on catalog:reviewerName, requiring its value to be a string with a minimum length of 2 characters, and another on catalog:rating, requiring its value to be a float between 0.0 and 5.0 (inclusive). Both properties must be present for the validation to succeed. If either or both properties are missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Customer review must include a reviewer name and rating (05)."

The SHACL shape :ReturnPolicyShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ReturnPolicy. It enforces two property constraints: the property catalog:returnWindowDays must be an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1, and the property catalog:restockingFee must be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum value of 0.0. Both properties must be present and satisfy these conditions to pass validation. If either property is missing or does not meet these requirements, validation will fail with the message: "Return policy must specify return window and optional restocking fee."

Here are the natural language translations for the provided SHACL shapes:

The SHACL shape :BundleDealShape targets all instances of the class catalog:BundleDeal. It specifies two property constraints: the property catalog:bundleItems must appear at least twice (minCount 2), and the property catalog:bundlePrice must have a value that is a non-negative float (xsd:float with minInclusive 0.0). If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Bundle deals must include at least 2 items and a bundle price."

The SHACL shape :ProductDimensionShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:ProductDimension. It specifies three property constraints: the properties catalog:height, catalog:width, and catalog:depth must each have a non-negative float value (xsd:float with minInclusive 0.0). If any of these properties are missing or invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Product dimensions must include non-negative height, width, and depth."

The SHACL shape :ProductStatusShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ProductStatus. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition. Either the property catalog:availability must have a value that is one of "InStock", "OutOfStock", or "Backorder", or the property catalog:discontinued must be present with a boolean value of true. If neither of these conditions is met, validation will fail with the message: "Product must either be available or marked as discontinued."

The SHACL shape :WarehouseDetailShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:WarehouseDetail. It specifies two property constraints, which must be satisfied simultaneously. The property catalog:locationCode requires a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 2 characters. Additionally, the property catalog:temperatureControlled requires a boolean value (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Warehouse details must include a location code and whether it is temperature controlled."

The SHACL shape :ProductMetadataShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ProductMetadata. It specifies a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: catalog:createdAt and catalog:lastUpdated, both of which must have a value of type dateTime (xsd:dateTime). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Product metadata must include creation and last update timestamps."

The SHACL shape :ProductVariantShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ProductVariant. It specifies a composite constraint on two properties: catalog:variantType and catalog:variantValue. The catalog:variantType property must have a value that is one of the following: "Color", "Size", or "Material". The catalog:variantValue property must have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 2 characters. Both properties must be present for each product variant. If this constraint is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Each product variant must specify type and value."

The SHACL shape :InventoryThresholdShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:InventoryThreshold. It specifies two concurrent property constraints. The first constraint requires the property catalog:reorderLevel to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 0. The second constraint requires the property catalog:maximumStock to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1. Both properties must be present for the constraint to be satisfied. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Inventory threshold must include reorder level and maximum stock values."

The SHACL shape :TaxationShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:Taxation. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied concurrently. First, the property catalog:taxCategory must have a value that is one of the allowed strings: "Standard", "Reduced", or "Exempt". Second, the property catalog:taxRate must be a floating-point number (xsd:float) within the inclusive range of 0.0 to 100.0. If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Taxation must include a valid category and a percentage tax rate."

The SHACL shape :SubscriptionPlanShape targets all instances of the class catalog:SubscriptionPlan. It enforces two constraints that must both be satisfied. Firstly, the property catalog:billingCycle must have exactly one value, which must be one of the following strings: "Monthly", "Quarterly", or "Yearly". Secondly, the property catalog:planPrice must have exactly one value, which must be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 0.0. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Subscription plan must define billing cycle and price."

The SHACL shape :ProductLabelShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:ProductLabel. It specifies a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: catalog:labelName and catalog:isEcoFriendly. The value of catalog:labelName must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and the value of catalog:isEcoFriendly must be a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Product label must include name and eco-friendly status."

The SHACL shape :CustomerReviewShape targets all instances of the class catalog:CustomerReview. It enforces two constraints. Firstly, the property catalog:rating must have a value that is a floating point number (xsd:float) between 1.0 and 5.0 (inclusive). Secondly, the property catalog:reviewText must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 10 characters. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Customer review must include a rating between 1 and 5 and a review message."

The SHACL shape :SeasonalAvailabilityShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:SeasonalAvailability. It specifies two required properties: catalog:startMonth and catalog:endMonth, both of which must have a value that is a month (xsd:gMonth). If either of these properties is missing, validation will fail with the message: "Seasonal availability must define start and end months."

The SHACL shape :StockMovementShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:StockMovement. It specifies two property constraints that must be both satisfied. The first constraint requires the property catalog:movementType to have a value that is either "Inbound" or "Outbound". The second constraint requires the property catalog:quantity to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 1. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Stock movement must indicate type and quantity moved."

The SHACL shape :ReturnPolicyShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:ReturnPolicy. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property catalog:returnWindowDays to have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 0. The second constraint requires the property catalog:restockingFeePercent to have a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum value of 0.0 and a maximum value of 100.0. If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Return policy must specify return window and optional restocking fee."

The SHACL shape :BrandShape targets all instances of the class catalog:Brand. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two properties: catalog:brandName and catalog:brandOrigin. Both properties must have string values (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 2 characters. If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified data type and length requirements, validation will fail with the message: "Brand must include name and country of origin."

The SHACL shape :PriceRangeShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:PriceRange. It specifies three property constraints that must be met for a valid price range. 

Firstly, the property catalog:minPrice must be present with a value that is a float (xsd:float) and is inclusive of 0.0 or greater. 

Secondly, the property catalog:maxPrice must be present with a value that is a float (xsd:float). 

Lastly, a SPARQL constraint ensures that the maximum price is greater than or equal to the minimum price. If any of these conditions are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Price range must include valid minimum and maximum prices."

The SHACL shape :SalesChannelShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:SalesChannel. It specifies two property constraints that must be simultaneously satisfied: 
the property catalog:channelType must have a value that is one of the following strings: "Online", "Retail", or "Wholesale"; 
the property catalog:isActive must have a boolean value (xsd:boolean). 
If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Sales channel must specify the type and its active status."

The SHACL shape :BulkDiscountShape targets all instances of the class catalog:BulkDiscount. It enforces two constraints on the properties catalog:minQuantity and catalog:discountRate. The value of catalog:minQuantity must be an integer (xsd:integer) no less than 2, while the value of catalog:discountRate must be a float (xsd:float) between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive). If either of these properties is missing, or their values do not meet these requirements, validation will fail with the message: "Bulk discount must include minimum quantity and discount rate."

The SHACL shape :WarehouseShape targets all instances of the class catalog:Warehouse. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property catalog:warehouseName to have at least 3 characters and be a string (xsd:string). The second constraint requires the property catalog:locationCode to be a string (xsd:string) and match the pattern "^[A-Z]{2}-\\d{3}$", i.e., exactly two uppercase letters followed by a hyphen and exactly three digits. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Warehouse must have a name and a valid location code (e.g., DE-123)."

The SHACL shape :BarcodeSpecShape applies to all instances of the class catalog:BarcodeSpec. It specifies a conjunction of two property constraints. The first constraint applies to the property catalog:barcodeValue, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^\\d{12,13}$". The second constraint applies to the property catalog:barcodeType, requiring its value to be one of the two allowed strings: "EAN-13" or "UPC-A". If either of these constraints is violated (i.e., the barcode value does not match the pattern or the type is not specified or invalid), validation will fail with the message: "Barcode must follow a valid pattern and specify its type."

The SHACL shape :ProductComparisonShape targets all instances of the class catalog:ProductComparison. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of two distinct IRI values for the properties catalog:comparedProduct1 and catalog:comparedProduct2. Furthermore, it specifies a SPARQL-based validation rule that checks if the values of these two properties are not identical. If the values are the same or if either property is missing, the validation will fail with the message: "Comparison must involve two distinct products." or "Compared products must not be the same."

The SHACL shape :RestaurantProfileShape applies to all instances of the class food:RestaurantProfile. It specifies two property constraints that must be jointly satisfied. The property food:restaurantName must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and the property food:location must also be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters. If either of these properties is missing or does not meet the specified length requirement, validation will fail with the message: "Restaurant profile must include name and location."

The SHACL shape :MenuItemShape targets all instances of the class food:MenuItem. It enforces two property constraints: the property food:itemName must have a value that is a string with a minimum length of 3 characters, and the property food:price must have a value that is a non-negative float (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 0.0. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Menu item must include a name and a non-negative price."

The SHACL shape :DeliveryStatusShape targets all instances of the class food:DeliveryStatus. It enforces a constraint that combines two requirements: the property food:status must have a value that is one of "Pending", "Out for Delivery", "Delivered", or "Cancelled", and the property food:updatedAt must have a value that is a date and time (xsd:dateTime). If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Delivery status must include a valid status and update time."

The SHACL shape :FoodAllergyInfoShape applies to all instances of the class food:AllergyInfo. It specifies two conjunctive property constraints. Firstly, the property food:containsAllergens must have a value that is one of the following: "Peanuts", "Dairy", "Gluten", "Soy", or "Shellfish". Secondly, the property food:advisoryNote must be present, its value must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Allergy info must specify allergens and provide an advisory note."

The SHACL shape :CustomerOrderShape applies to all instances of the class food:CustomerOrder. It specifies two simultaneous property constraints: 
The property food:orderID must be a string (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^ORD-\\d{5}$". 
The property food:orderTotal must be a float (xsd:float) with a minimum value of 0.0. 
If either of these conditions is not met (i.e., the order ID is invalid or the total amount is less than 0), validation will fail with the message: 
"Customer order must include a valid ID and total amount."

The SHACL shape :DeliveryDriverShape targets all instances of the class food:DeliveryDriver. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property food:driverID to have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 4 characters. The second constraint requires the property food:vehicleType to have a value that is one of the following: "Bicycle", "Scooter", or "Car". If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Delivery driver must have an ID and a valid vehicle type."

The SHACL shape :KitchenTicketShape targets all instances of the class food:KitchenTicket. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property food:ticketNumber to have a value that is a string (xsd:string) matching the pattern "^KT\\d{4}$". The second constraint requires the property food:isPrepared to have a value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Kitchen ticket must include a valid ticket number and preparation status."

The SHACL shape :MealRatingShape applies to all instances of the class food:MealRating. It enforces two property constraints: the property food:ratingValue must have a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) between 1 (minInclusive) and 5 (maxInclusive), and the property food:reviewComment must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Meal rating must include a value between 15 and a comment."

The SHACL shape :PromotionalOfferShape targets all instances of the class food:PromotionalOffer. It enforces two concurrent constraints: The property food:offerCode must have a string value (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^SAVE\\d{2}$", and the property food:discountPercentage must have a float value (xsd:float) within the range of 1.0 (inclusive) to 100.0 (inclusive). If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Offer must include a valid code and discount percentage."
